definition: to herd/to breed livestock/to govern (old)/government official (old)
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
nomadic/to move about in search of pasture/to rove around as a nomad
Muye district of Xinxiang city 新鄉市|新乡市[Xin1 xiang1 shi4], Henan

sentences.english: The vicar left his position near the soldier, and disappeared into a back room.
sentences.chinese: 牧師從位於士兵身旁的他的位置上離開，走進了後房。

sentences.english: The humble in sheep station worked all day, very grateful friend Tony.
sentences.chinese: 一介在牧羊場工作了一整天，好友湯尼感激不盡。

sentences.english: Brought up by the herdsmen , he became a strong, handsome lad.
sentences.chinese: 在牧人們的精心撫養下，孩子長得既強壯又英俊。

sentences.english: Browse or Buy Makita Workwear Today.
sentences.chinese: 瀏覽或購買牧工作服今天。

sentences.english: We pursue all-around development in farming, forestry, animal husbandry, and fishery.
sentences.chinese: 我們要做到農，林，牧，魚統一發展。

sentences.english: They observe the movement of lions and warn herders of their presence.
sentences.chinese: 他們觀察獅子的動靜並在獅子出現時警告牧人們。

sentences.english: My name is Wesley Cheng, and the flight number is UA 003 for Toronto.
sentences.chinese: 我的名字是傑瑞煩“嗷怕朧欠賞逕薊牧蝦嬌03班機。

sentences.english: After his cow had enough to drink, he started to take her to a grassy field.
sentences.chinese: 乳牛喝足了水後，他便牽着它到牧草場喫草。

definition: barley/to moo/to seek or obtain/old variant of 侔[mou2]/old variant of 眸[mou2]
pool/pond/(of metals etc) luster/favor or beneficence/damp/moist
to divine/to forecast or estimate/(of a place to live etc) to choose
Jie people, a tribe of northern China around the 4th century
a noble steed (literary)/(of a horse) untamed/(fig.) (of a person) headstrong/Taiwan pr. [ao2]
